forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 3 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 10pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 48. West northwest wind 10 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
A quiet stillness settles over Downtown San Francisco today, enveloped in misty gray clouds that hint at the rain to come. Though the high temperature attempts to rise to a cool 59 degrees, the air feels heavier, with a palpable humidity lingering in the atmosphere. As the morning transitions toward afternoon, the clouds thicken, producing a somber ambiance echoing the city's iconic charm—everything from the Golden Gate to the historic streets takes on a muted tone.

For those navigating the city this afternoon, a long-sleeved shirt paired with a light jacket will offer just enough comfort against the damp breeze stirring from the southwest. A brisk walk through the vibrant neighborhoods might unveil rain-washed pavements glistening under the muted light, encouraging a moment of reflection amidst the bustling daily life. Given the likelihood of rain, perhaps a leisurely visit to one of San Francisco's cozy cafes would be ideal—sipping hot coffee while watching the rain dance against the windows offers a nurturing pause from the day’s tasks. Tonight, as the chance for precipitation lingers into the evening hours, the city will draw into itself, cloaked in another layer of soothing mist.
